title: Get the publishing status of a TikTok post

headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Access token authorized by TikTok creators. To obtain an access token, use /tt_user/oauth2/token/ .

parameters.name: business_id
parameters.description: Application specific unique identifier for the TikTok account. Pass the value of the open_id field returned in the response of /tt_user/oauth2/token/ to this field.

parameters.name: publish_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for a post publishing task. Pass the value of the share_id field returned in the response of /business/video/publish/ or /business/photo/publish/ to this field.

top_fields.name: code
top_fields.description: Response code. For the complete list of response codes and descriptions, see Appendix-Return Code .

top_fields.name: message
top_fields.description: Response message. For details, see Appendix - Return Codes .

top_fields.name: request_id
top_fields.description: The log ID of a request, which uniquely identifies the request.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The publishing status of the TikTok post. Enum values: PROCESSING_DOWNLOAD : The download of content from the URL is in progress. This status is only available when you publish the post using a file URL. PUBLISH_COMPLETE : The post has passed moderation and has been successfully published. FAILED : The publishing process failed due to an error. SEND_TO_USER_INBOX : The draft post has been successfully uploaded and the system has sent a corresponding notification to creator's inbox.

fields.name: post_ids
fields.description: Returned only when status is PUBLISH_COMPLETE and the posts are publicly viewable. The unique identifiers for the published TikTok posts. Note : Post IDs require up to three minutes of processing time. If post IDs are not immediately available in the initial response, retry after three minutes. You can use the IDs as the filter field video_ids in /business/video/list/ to obtain the detailed metrics for the posts.

fields.name: reason
fields.description: Returned only when status is FAILED . The reason for the publishing failure. Example: frame_rate_check_failed . To find out the detailed description for each reason, see Failure reasons .
